meanings.definition: The act of punishing someone for a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The punishment for not doing homework was having to stay in during recess.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided on a fair punishment for the thief.
meanings.sent3: The punishment for eating all the cookies was having to do extra chores.
meanings.sent4: His punishment for being late was to write a hundred lines of apology.
meanings.sent5: The punishment for cheating in the game was being disqualified and sent home.

meanings.definition: A penalty imposed for breaking a rule or law.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a punishment to the student who was talking during the test.
meanings.sent2: The punishment for speeding is usually a fine.
meanings.sent3: The punishment for not finishing the race was having to start over.
meanings.sent4: The punishment for parking in the wrong spot was getting a ticket.
meanings.sent5: The punishment for breaking the school rule was detention after class.
